title: Blurite sword

properties.name: description
properties.value: The blurite sword is a longsword that requires 1 Attack to wield. It is created during the quest The Knight's Sword as a replacement to the one that the squire has lost. It is obtained by giving a blurite ore and two iron bars to Thurgo after showing him a portrait of the sword.

The blurite sword is a longsword that requires 1 Attack to wield. It is created during the quest The Knight's Sword as a replacement to the one that the squire has lost. It is obtained by giving a blurite ore and two iron bars to Thurgo after showing him a portrait of the sword.

The blurite sword has the same attack and defence bonuses as a steel longsword with the strength bonus of an iron longsword. It is slightly worse than Silverlight. Because of this and the fact that there is no Attack level needed to wield it, the blurite sword is sought by some lower level players at the start of the game.

If players wish to obtain a blurite sword for themselves, they can bring another blurite ore and two iron bars to Thurgo after completing the quest.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 January 2020
(update | poll)

The blurite sword can now be obtained after completing The Knight's Sword by giving Thurgo a blurite ore and two iron bars.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Blurite sword has a missing section in the hilt's grip above the player's hand and just below the crossguard.
  • It was called the 'Faladian Knight's sword' in RuneScape Classic.

[[File:Blurite sword detail.png|left|100px]]
The '''blurite sword''' is a longsword that requires 1 [[Attack]] to wield. It is created during the quest [[The Knight's Sword]] as a replacement to the one that the squire has lost. It is obtained by giving a [[blurite ore]] and two [[iron bar]]s to [[Thurgo]] after showing him a portrait of the sword.

The blurite sword has the same attack and defence bonuses as a [[steel longsword]] with the strength bonus of an [[iron longsword]]. It is slightly worse than [[Silverlight]]. Because of this and the fact that there is no Attack level needed to wield it, the blurite sword is sought by some lower level players at the start of the game.

If players wish to obtain a blurite sword for themselves, they can bring another blurite ore and two iron bars to Thurgo after completing the quest.
